_**User**_

Help me design a min-maxing tool for character 'builds' in the Elder Scrolls Online PvE play (not Battlegrounds or Cyrodiil or Imperial City or Duelling) for PC (not Xbox or Playstation).  We'll focus the build on 12-person Trials first, then we can consider 4-person play like Dungeons or Arenas, and then also solo arena play.  But those will come later.  First is for Trials.
Builds are comprised of race, equipment, food, potions, and mundus.  These will be specific to role, such as healer, tank, and (damage dealer or DPS or DD).  Within the DD subset may also be a 'support DPS' (sometimes, for example, a dragonknight can focus on using the stone giant skill to keep 'stagger' uptimes high, or a sorcerer will focus on using crystal weapon to reduce the enemy's armour by 1000 because it stacks with major and minor breach, for instance).
Each build will be specific to both the player's class; we can bear in mind, however, that there are more than just class skills, there are weapon line skills, guild skill lines, lines for vampirism and werewolf, scribed skills and also the subclassing feature which allows a user to keep one class skill line but also add in up to two skill lines from up to two other classes.
These builds can also change per boss fight within given trials but we will focus on the basics of optimal builds per role per trial per class.  This will be for an individual of a given class in their role (e.g. - Arcanist Damage Dealer

The complication with this endeavour is that the builds will likely change after a given patch update in the game.  There are often changes to class skills, etc.  

This project is a challenge of data sources first and foremost.  Then it is a problem of optimisation and combinatoric optimisation.  

With all of this information in mind can you help me to define a design plan and help to source the data.  For instance there are websites (https://eso-hub.com and the patch notes found https://forums.elderscrollsonline.com/en/categories/patch-notes ) but I am sure that there are more efficient ways of doing this by looking at the game files or other APIs?  Please think hard and find the best sources for the data that will not suffer from recognition lag (e.g. - human intervention to update a website).

The user wants to design a min-maxing tool for ESO (Elder Scrolls Online) character builds, focused on:
1. PvE only (no PvP)

4. Build components: race, equipment, food, potions, mundus
5. Roles: healer, tank, DD (including support DPS)
6. Class-specific, with complexity from weapon lines, guild lines, vamp/werewolf, scribing, subclassing
7. Can vary per boss/trial but starting with optimal per role per trial per class

Key challenges they've identified:
- Data sources (primary challenge)
- Optimization/combinatoric optimization
- Patch updates change builds - need data that doesn't have "recognition lag" (human-updated websites lag behind)

They want:
1. A design plan
2. Data sourcing - especially looking for game files or APIs that would update automatically with patches rather than relying on manually-updated sites like eso-hub.com or forum patch notes

Let me think about ESO data sources:

**Game files / APIs (lowest lag):**
- ESO is a Zenimax/Bethesda game. They don't have a public API for game data that I'm aware of.
- The game client has data files - on PC these are often in the game installation directory. ESO uses a proprietary format but the addon community has reverse-engineered a lot.
- **ESO Addons** use Lua and access game APIs - the in-game API (like GetItemLinkItemType, GetNumSkillAbilities, etc.) - so the *runtime* data is in the client. Addons like Itemization Browser, etc. read this.
- **LibAddonMenu**, **LibStub** - addon infrastructure
- **UESP** and **ESO-Hub** scrape or manually update - lag
- **Official patch notes** - authoritative for changes but not a structured DB

**Possible data sources with minimal lag:**
1. **ESO game client files** - The game stores item/skill/ability data in .dat or similar. There are tools that parse these. "ESO-DAT" or similar projects - the community has extracted strings and sometimes structure from game files when Zenimax updates them.
2. **PTS (Public Test Server)** - Patches hit PTS first; datamining there gives earliest signal.
3. **Addon-derived data** - Addons can dump the current game's items/skills/effects. Someone could run an addon on live/PTS that exports item IDs, set bonuses, skill tooltips, etc. to JSON/CSV. This would be "as of last run" - update by re-running after each patch.
4. **Community datamining** - Sites like ESO-Hub may get data from dataminers who parse game files. So the *source* might be game files, but the *delivery* is a website that lags.
5. **ESO API** - I should search if there's any official or unofficial API. I don't recall an official one. Unofficial: maybe something that scrapes ESO-Hub or similar.

Let me search the codebase to see if there's any existing structure, then provide a design plan and data-source research.

I'll:
1. Search the project for any existing design or data structures
2. Web search for ESO datamining, game files, API, addon data export
3. Produce a design document covering architecture, data sources, and optimization approach
</details></think>

[A comprehensive guide on damage dealing in Elder Scrolls Online](https://forums.elderscrollsonline.com/en/discussion/422268/a-comprehensive-guide-on-damage-dealing-in-elder-scrolls-online)<br/><br/># ESO Item Set Bonus Information<br/><br/>## Basic Structure<br/><br/>Item set bonuses activate once you equip two or more pieces of a set, with additional bonuses at higher piece counts.[2] Most sets have a maximum limit—typically 5 pieces—where you receive the final bonus but no further benefits beyond that point.[1]<br/><br/>Set bonuses are only active while gear is equipped and active, and you can receive benefits from multiple sets simultaneously.[2] Monster sets have only 2 pieces (head and shoulders), while Mythic items are special one-piece sets with a maximum of one per character.[2]<br/><br/>## Bonus Types and Design<br/><br/>ESO contains over 650 unique item sets across the game's 10-year history.[1] Set bonuses are categorized by complexity—ranging from simple passive bonuses that activate when equipped to more nuanced mechanics requiring specific actions or situational conditions.[1]<br/><br/>Most sets are combat-focused, offering various types of power for different playstyles (ranged/melee, magicka/stamina, damage/healing/tanking).[1] Some sets provide utility or roleplay opportunities outside combat.[1]<br/><br/>## Damage Calculation<br/><br/>Damage calculations in ESO follow a comprehensive formula incorporating skill coefficients for both maximum stats and power, modified by critical chance, critical damage, armor mitigation, and various damage amplifiers.[5] Tooltip values appear to be generated from skill coefficient data maintained by the UESP community, with regression analysis achieving R² accuracy of 99.99%.[3][5] |

Summary of what’s in place and how it fits your goals:

---

## Design plan and data sources

Two docs are in your repo:

- **`docs/DESIGN_PLAN.md`** – Full design: scope (Trials, PC, PvE, roles), build components, **data sources ordered by recognition lag**, data model, optimization approach, pipeline, and phased implementation.
- **`docs/DATA_SOURCES.md`** – Short reference table of sources and how to use them.

---

## Data strategy (minimal patch lag)

**Best approach: data you control**

- **Primary:** Run an **addon inside ESO** after each patch that dumps sets, items, skills (and optionally mundus, food, potions) to JSON/Lua (e.g. SavedVariables). You version each dump by game build. That gives you **no recognition lag** – you decide when to refresh.
- **Existing options:** [ESO Data Dumper](https://github.com/sevenseacat/eso_data_dumper) (achievements/dyes; extend or copy for sets/skills), [Item Set Dumper](https://www.esoui.com/downloads/info3488-ItemSetDumper.html) (sets only). A small **custom addon** that calls ESO’s Lua API (e.g. set collection, `GetItemLinkSetInfo`, skill/ability APIs) and writes structured JSON is the most flexible and future-proof.
- **Raw client data:** [EsoExtractData](https://www.esoui.com/downloads/info1258-EsoExtractData.html) reads ESO’s `.mnf`/`.dat` files; highest fidelity but heavy (100GB+ full export) and reverse‑engineered formats.

**Best external sources (low lag)**

- **[UESP ESO API](https://esoapi.uesp.net/index.html)** – Lua API/globals **per game build** (e.g. v101047). Updated when their extractor runs (usually within days of a patch). Use for: mapping build ↔ your data version and for API names when building your addon.
- **[UESP Skill Coefficients](https://esoitem.uesp.net/viewSkillCoef.php)** – ~7k skills with **damage/heal equations** (MaxStat, MaxPower, ratios, ticks). Essential for DPS/heal math; community‑maintained with high accuracy (R² ~0.9999). Use as the **source for all skill coefficients** in your optimizer.
- **[UESP ESO Log](https://esolog.uesp.net/viewlog.php)** – Datamined records (`setSummary`, `minedItem`, `minedSkills`) from the **uespLog** addon (players upload). Use to validate or fill gaps; lag depends on when players submit after a patch.

**Secondary / fallback**

- **[ESO Sets API](https://eso-sets.herokuapp.com/)** (REST/GraphQL) – set names, types, bonuses; likely manual or periodic updates.
- **[LibSets](https://github.com/Baertram/LibSets)** – set data in Lua for addons; maintainer updates per patch; can be parsed into your DB.

**Reference only (do not drive the optimizer)**

- **ESO-Hub** and similar sites – human‑curated, so recognition lag is high.
- **Official [patch notes](https://forums.elderscrollsonline.com/en/categories/patch-notes)** – use for “what changed” and to **label builds** (e.g. “Update 48 Incremental 3”), not as a full data dump.

So: **no game files or official APIs** expose a full, clean DB; the most reliable and up‑to‑date setup is **addon export as primary**, **UESP for skill coefficients and build versioning**, and **ESO Log / Sets API / LibSets as secondary or validation**.

---

## Optimization and pipeline (from the design)

- **Build** = race + equipment (2× 5‑piece + monster + optional mythic) + food + potions + mundus; later: skills/rotation.
- **Data model** in the design doc: versioned by **GameBuild**; entities for sets, items, skills (with coefficients), buffs, mundus, food, potions, races.
- **Optimization:** For each (build, class, role) compute derived stats from sets/race/food/potions/mundus, then **DPS** (or HPS/survivability) using **UESP skill coefficients** and standard ESO damage formulas. Restrict to trial‑viable sets to keep combinatorics manageable; use greedy/beam search or small CP model over set choices and slot layout.
- **Pipeline:** Ingest (addon + UESP coef) → normalize (stat block + damage formula) → optimize (per class/role) → output optimal Trials builds; later extend to support DD, healer, tank, then per‑trial/boss, then 4‑person and solo.

If you tell me your preferred stack (e.g. Python + SQLite, or Node + JSON files), I can outline a concrete ingest schema and a first “stat block + single‑target DPS” module that consumes your addon JSON and the UESP skill coefficient data.

<think><details><summary>Thought Process</summary>

The user is asking for a recommendation on the tech stack for the ESO Build Genius project. They've stated they're stronger in Python/SQL but are open to Node + JSON with no strong preference.

Let me think about what this project needs:

1. **Data ingestion**
   - Parsing JSON/Lua from addon exports
   - Scraping or fetching from UESP (skill coefficients, possibly setSummary) - HTTP requests, HTML parsing
   - Storing versioned game data by build

2. **Data model & storage**
   - Relational structure: GameBuild, ItemSet, Item, Skill (with coefficients), Buff, Mundus, Food, Potion, Race, Build (output)
   - Versioning by build is natural in SQL (e.g. build_id on every table, or a single "current" snapshot)
   - Queries: "all sets for build X", "skill coefficients for ability id Y in build X", "top builds for class/role"

3. **Optimization**
   - Combinatoric search: iterate or search over set combinations, slot assignments
   - Numeric heavy: stat block calculation, damage formula (floats, many multiplications)
   - Python has: numpy, scipy, pulp/OR-Tools for optimization; pandas for tabular
   - Node has: numeric libs but less standard for optimization; can still do brute-force or simple solvers

4. **Pipeline**
   - Scriptable: run ingest → normalize → optimize; cron or manual
   - Python: scripts, pandas, SQLAlchemy or raw SQL
   - Node: scripts, better if real-time API or front-end in JS/TS

5. **Future**
   - Optional: REST API to serve "best build for Arcanist DD"
   - Optional: simple UI (could be any front-end calling API)
   - Either stack can host a small API (FastAPI/Flask vs Express)

**Recommendation:** Python + SQL is a better fit here because:
- **Optimization:** Python's ecosystem (numpy, scipy.optimize, or constraint solvers like PuLP, OR-Tools, or even just pandas + loops) is standard for this kind of numeric/combinatoric work. Node can do it but it's not the natural choice.
- **Data wrangling:** Parsing UESP pages (e.g. skill coef table), normalizing set bonuses, building stat blocks = lots of tabular and string handling. Pandas + Python is ideal; Node + JSON is fine but more manual.
- **SQL:** They're stronger in SQL. A proper schema with GameBuild, sets, skills, etc. fits a relational DB well; versioning is straightforward (build_id everywhere or snapshot tables). SQLite is enough to start; can move to Postgres if needed.
- **Ingestion:** Both can do HTTP + parsing. Python has requests + BeautifulSoup or lxml; Node has axios + cheerio. Toss-up.
- **Addon output:** Addon will write JSON or Lua. Python's json and (if Lua) a small parser or regex is easy; Node same. Toss-up.
- **Single developer, stronger in Python/SQL:** Leveraging their strength means faster iteration and fewer bugs. Node + JSON would work but doesn't offer a clear advantage unless they specifically want a JS-only stack for a future React/Next front-end.

I'll recommend Python + SQL (SQLite to start) and optionally FastAPI for a small API later. I can add a short "Tech stack" section to the design doc and/or a STACK.md that records this and the rationale.
</details></think>

Summary of what’s in place:

**Recommendation: Python + SQL (SQLite to start)**

- **Optimization** – Stat math, damage formula, and set search are a good fit for NumPy/Pandas and, later, PuLP or OR-Tools. Python’s numeric/optimization ecosystem is a better match than Node for this.

- **Your background** – Using Python/SQL lets you move faster and with fewer surprises than Node + JSON.

**Concrete stack**

- **Python 3.11+**, **SQLite** (one DB or file-based), **Pandas** for transforms, **NumPy** for the damage formula.
- **Optional:** BeautifulSoup/lxml for UESP; PuLP or OR-Tools when you add the combinatoric optimizer; **FastAPI** if you add a small REST API later.

---

## DB schema (Python + SQLite)

**1. Schema files (`schema/`)**

- **`01_schema.sql`**  
  - **Versioning:** `game_builds`, `ingest_runs`  
  - **Reference (fixed):** `equipment_slots` (11 slots), `classes` (7), `roles` (4), `set_types`, `races` (10)  
  - **Per-build game data:** `item_sets`, `set_bonuses`, `set_slots`, `skills` (with `coefficient_json`), `buffs`, `mundus_stones`, `foods`, `potions`, `race_effects`  
  - **Optimizer output:** `recommended_builds`, `recommended_build_equipment`  
  - **Later:** `trials`, `trial_bosses`  
  - **Seed data:** Inserts for set_types, equipment_slots, classes, roles, races  

- **`02_indexes.sql`**  
  - Indexes for common filters (build + set_type, build + class, etc.)

**2. Script**

- **`scripts/create_db.py`**  
  - Runs all `schema/*.sql` in order and creates `data/eso_build_genius.db` (path can be overridden with a CLI argument).

**3. Docs and project hygiene**

- **`docs/SCHEMA.md`** – Short description of tables and how to create the DB.  
- **`.gitignore`** – Ignores `data/`, `.env`, `__pycache__`, venvs.  
- **`.env.example`** – Documents that ESO credentials (if ever needed) go in env vars; no real credentials in the repo.

**4. Credentials**

- Your ESO username and password are **not** stored anywhere in the project.  
- If we ever need login (e.g. for an official API), we’ll use **environment variables** (e.g. `ESO_USERNAME`, `ESO_PASSWORD`) and a local `.env` that stays out of git. Put them only in your own `.env`; don’t commit it.

**Create the DB**

```bash
python scripts/create_db.py
```

DB path: `data/eso_build_genius.db`. The script has been run once; the DB is ready for ingest work next (e.g. loading one `game_builds` row and then sets/skills/foods from addon or UESP).

{

  "markdown": "Online:Combat - UESP Wiki - The Unofficial Elder Scrolls Pages\n\n# Online:Combat\n\n&lt; [Elder Scrolls Online](https://en.uesp.net/wiki/Online:Online): [Hints](https://en.uesp.net/wiki/Online:Hints)(Redirected from [Online:Light Attack](https://en.uesp.net/w/index.php?title=Online:Light_Attack&amp;amp;redirect=no))\n\nCombat in [Elder Scrolls Online](https://en.uesp.net/wiki/Online:Online) is dynamic. The game offers players a variety of visual and auditory cues about which actions may be appropriate next, including marking the area of impending enemy attacks in red, or by prompting the user to block or interrupt.\n\n## Basic Combat Actions\n\nAll players have a variety of abilities that they can use in combat, which do not require any skills to be learned or slotted. Some of these have associated passive skills which reduce their cost or improve their effectiveness.\n\n### Light Attack\n\nThis is a quick attack that can be performed with any weapon. If an opponent is targeted and in range, it will damage the opponent. It is performed by tapping the attack button.\n\nLight attacks require no [Stamina](https://en.uesp.net/wiki/Online:Stamina) or [Magicka](https://en.uesp.net/wiki/Online:Magicka). The damage of light attacks, regardless of weapon type, scales with your highest offensive stats. [Prior to Update 28](https://forums.elderscrollsonline.com/en/discussion/550927/pc-mac-patch-notes-v6-2-5-markarth-update-28#latest), the damage of light attacks scaled with your Maximum [Stamina](https://en.uesp.net/wiki/Online:Stamina) and [Weapon Damage](https://en.uesp.net/wiki/Online:Weapon_Damage), or Maximum [Magicka](https://en.uesp.net/wiki/Online:Magicka) and [Spell Damage](https://en.uesp.net/wiki/Online:Spell_Damage) for staves.\n\nHitting a light attack while in combat gives you a hidden buff which generates 3 [Ultimate](https://en.uesp.net/wiki/Online:Ultimate) every second for 9 seconds and resets its duration everytime you hit a light attack while in combat.\n\n### Heavy Attack\n\nThis is an attack which must be charged. It does more damage per attack than light attacks, though less damage per second due to the charging time. There may also be further effects. Using a heavy attack against an [Off Balance](https://en.uesp.net/wiki/Online:Off_Balance) opponent will knock them down, deal 70% more damage and restore double the ressources. Heavy attacks are performed by holding the attack button.\n\nHeavy attacks require no [Stamina](https://en.uesp.net/wiki/Online:Stamina) or [Magicka](https://en.uesp.net/wiki/Online:Magicka).The damage of heavy attack, regardless of weapon type, scales with your highest offensive stats. [Prior to Update 28](https://forums.elderscrollsonline.com/en/discussion/550927/pc-mac-patch-notes-v6-2-5-markarth-update-28#latest), the damage of heavy attacks scaled with your Maximum [Stamina](https://en.uesp.net/wiki/Online:Stamina) and [Weapon Damage](https://en.uesp.net/wiki/Online:Weapon_Damage), or Maximum [Magicka](https://en.uesp.net/wiki/Online:Magicka) and [Spell Damage](https://en.uesp.net/wiki/Online:Spell_Damage) for staves. The return of either stamina or magicka resource points from a heavy attack is still determined by weapon type: staves restore magicka, while bows and melee weapons give you a return in stamina.\n\n- Releasing the attack button before it is fully charged will still result in an attack, which deals more damage than a light attack, but will not restore resources or trigger certain sets or abilities which call for a \"fully charged\" heavy attack. This is sometimes referred to as a \"medium attack\" in patch notes.\n- 8 Mechanics\n\n- Heavy attacks restore [Magicka](https://en.uesp.net/wiki/Online:Magicka)(with staves) or [Stamina](https://en.uesp.net/wiki/Online:Stamina)(other weapons) when fully charged. The amount restored scales to the length of time that the heavy attack takes to charge, so for example, a heavy attack with a 2-handed weapon will restore more [Stamina](https://en.uesp.net/wiki/Online:Stamina) than when dual wielding. The amount restored also scales with player level.\n\n- Restoration staves and Lightning staves will begin channeling damage as soon as the heavy attack begins. This can be a detriment if you don't want to catch the attention of an enemy until the attack is fully charged.\n\n- Heavy attacks with a Frost Staff used to [Taunt](https://en.uesp.net/wiki/Online:Taunt) an enemy if you had points in the [Tri Focus](https://en.uesp.net/wiki/Online:Tri_Focus) skill. As of [Update 28](https://forums.elderscrollsonline.com/en/discussion/550927/pc-mac-patch-notes-v6-2-5-markarth-update-28#latest), this taunt was moved to [Destructive Clench](https://en.uesp.net/wiki/Online:Destructive_Touch).\n\n### Blocking\n\nA Tank charging a Power Bash. Note the yellow lines that indicate this attack should be blocked.\n\nBlocking can be performed with any weapon and even when unarmed. For most attacks, a successful block will reduce your damage taken and prevent any negative disabling effects associated with that attack. The cost of blocking depends on the player's level. Blocking an enemy's heavy attack will set it [Off Balance](https://en.uesp.net/wiki/Online:Off_Balance). It is not possible to light attack or heavy attack while blocking.\n\n- Damage from areas dealing damage over time (DoT) like [Wall of Elements](https://en.uesp.net/wiki/Online:Wall_of_Elements) and effects that are on or inside characters such as [Daedric Curse](https://en.uesp.net/wiki/Online:Daedric_Curse) cannot be blocked.\n\n- Secondary effects associated with attacks (such as the Major Breach from [Noxious Breath](https://en.uesp.net/wiki/Online:Noxious_Breath)) cannot be blocked, even if the main damage from the attack can.\n\n- Pressing the attack key while blocking does a Bash. Bash is a melee range attack with your weapon dealing physical damage to the enemy. It interrupts enemies and can trigger your weapon's poisons and enchantements. If you interrupt an enemy with a bash, the bash's damage is increased.\n\n### Roll Dodging\n\nA Fire Mage and his Fire Rune. Note the red circle that indicates this area should be avoided.\n\n[Area of Effect](https://en.uesp.net/wiki/Online:Area_of_Effect) attacks are often indicated as red areas. Roll dodging allows the player to roll in a given direction in order to escape an area of effect or break free of a rooting effect. The [Stamina](https://en.uesp.net/wiki/Online:Stamina) cost of dodging depends on the player's level. When rolling, all incoming attacks will automatically miss. Roll dodging also disables collision with all NPCs, so you can roll right through any enemy. This is useful for escaping if you're surrounded, but can also be used outside of combat to get past NPCs who are in your way. Performing a roll dodge will give the player dodge roll fatigue, increasing the cost of consecutive rolls until the effect dissipates.\n\n- Damage from ground target AOEs like [Wall of Elements](https://en.uesp.net/wiki/Online:Wall_of_Elements) or [Caltrops](https://en.uesp.net/wiki/Online:Caltrops) and effects that are on or inside characters such as [Daedric Curse](https://en.uesp.net/wiki/Online:Daedric_Curse) cannot be dodged.\n\n- Damage from magical AOEs such as [Drain Power](https://en.uesp.net/wiki/Online:Drain_Power) and beams such as [Soul Assault](https://en.uesp.net/wiki/Online:Soul_Assault) or the heavy attacks from restoration and lightning staves cannot be dodged. The last AoE tick from a lightning staff heavy attack is the exception to this and can be dodged.\n\n### Interrupting\n\nA Fire Mage charging Heat Wave. Note the red lines that indicate this attack should be interrupted.\n\nPlayers can interrupt an opponent who is winding up an attack, as long as they are within melee range. Successfully interrupting an opponent stuns them and throws them off balance. The [Stamina](https://en.uesp.net/wiki/Online:Stamina) cost of interrupting depends on the player's level.\n\n- Some active abilities, such as [Venom Arrow](https://en.uesp.net/wiki/Online:Venom_Arrow), can also interrupt. There is no additional [Stamina](https://en.uesp.net/wiki/Online:Stamina) cost beyond the normal cost of using the ability.\n\n### Breaking Free\n\nA character performing Break Free. Note the swirls at the character's feet that indicate immunity to crowd control.\n\nPlayers can break free of some forms of crowd controlling effects, such as stuns. The [Stamina](https://en.uesp.net/wiki/Online:Stamina) cost of breaking free depends on the player's level. After breaking free, the player gains \"​ Crowd Control Immunity\", which makes them immune to crowd control effects for 7 seconds.\n\n### Stealth\n\nStealth enables you to sneak without drawing an enemy's attention, and greatly reduces the distance you can be seen by enemy players in Cyrodiil. Any attack inflicted while you are sneaking and undetected will automatically crit, and you will subsequently stop sneaking. When you are in sneak mode, your [Stamina](https://en.uesp.net/wiki/Online:Stamina) will drain while moving, and recharge when you stand still. Moving in stealth also comes with a significant speed penalty, which can be avoided by using certain sets, or with the [vampirism](https://en.uesp.net/wiki/Online:Vampirism) passive [Dark Stalker](https://en.uesp.net/wiki/Online:Dark_Stalker). You cannot get in stealth and even crouch as a [Werewolf](https://en.uesp.net/wiki/Online:Werewolf)\n\n## Skills\n\nPlayers can slot 5 active or toggled [abilities](https://en.uesp.net/wiki/Online:Skills), in addition to a single ultimate ability. These are the main skills that a player uses in combat, and are known as the combat bar.\n\nOnce a player reaches level 15, they can switch between two combat bars. This requires having two different sets of weapons (or weapons and shields).\n\n- The damage and effect of abilities are calculated regarding the bar that was active when the ability is used, even if the effect or damage carry on after bar switching.\n- You cannot use the same weapon for both bars, but you can use a second identical weapon for the second bar, if you wish.\n\n### Active Abilities\n\nActive abilities usually have an attribute resource cost associated with them.\n\nMost weapon abilities require [stamina](https://en.uesp.net/wiki/Online:Stamina).\n\n- The exception is staff abilities (both [destruction](https://en.uesp.net/wiki/Online:Destruction_Staff) and [restoration](https://en.uesp.net/wiki/Online:Restoration_Staff)), which require magicka.\n\nSome active abilities require a hostile target before they can be used. Other abilities may automatically pick a target. Abilities with an area of effect may require the player to target an area on the ground after clicking the key for the ability, while others are simply centered around the player and require no aiming.\n\n### Toggled Abilities\n\nSome abilities are toggled, which means they remain active until the user disables them. These abilities may have a one-time cost associated with them, in addition to a constant negative effect, such as a ressource cost.\n\n- Toggled skills stay active after switching your combat bar, even if the other combat car doesn't have the toggled skill slotted in.\n- Abilities from other skill lines, such as those from factions or armor, usually also require stamina or magicka.\n\n### Ultimate Abilities\n\nOnly one ultimate ability may be slotted at one time. Ultimate abilities charge over time by accumulating points of Ultimate. Damaging an enemy with a light or heavy attack will grant 3 Ultimate per second for 9 seconds. Other effects may also grant additional Ultimate, such as the Major or Minor Heroism effect as well as the Banish the Wicked or Combat Frenzy passives. The weapon [trait](https://en.uesp.net/wiki/Online:Traits) Decisive provides you with a percentage-based chance (up to a maximum of 40%) to gain 1 additional point of Ultimate any time you gain Ultimate normally. Once the ability is fully charged, it may be used.\n\n- You can store up to 500 Ultimate points.\n- Healing a player who is gaining Ultimate will also grant you Ultimate at the same rate.\n- Using an ultimate ability completely drains your ultimate points to zero, regardless of whether you had extra ultimate charged.\n\n### Slotted Abilities\n\nWhile all slotted abilities will fall into one of the above categories, some abilities will also provide a bonus to players simply by being slotted. An example of this is [Restoring Aura](https://en.uesp.net/wiki/Online:Restoring_Aura).\n\n### Synergies\n\nSome skills have [synergies](https://en.uesp.net/wiki/Online:Synergy), which allow allies to perform a variety of beneficial actions once a skill is used. Allies will see a message informing them that they are able to activate the synergy, which has no cost to the player who activates it. Synergies themselves cannot be slotted. Some examples of skills with synergies are [Lightning Splash](https://en.uesp.net/wiki/Online:Lightning_Splash)(with the Conduit synergy) or [Nova](https://en.uesp.net/wiki/Online:Nova)(with the Supernova synergy). Each synergy has a cooldown preventing the same player from activating it continuously. Other synergies such as the \"Brace for Impact\" buff (while fighting [Lord Warden Dusk](https://en.uesp.net/wiki/Online:Lord_Warden_Dusk) in the [Imperial City Prison](https://en.uesp.net/wiki/Online:Imperial_City_Prison)) or the \"Use Free Ally\" synergy (when fighting [Ruzozuzalpamaz](https://en.uesp.net/wiki/Online:Ruzozuzalpamaz) in the [Crypt of Hearts](https://en.uesp.net/wiki/Online:Crypt_of_Hearts_II)) are not related to player skills, but are needed to overcome the mechanics of the boss fight itself. These tend not to have cooldowns and can be activated by anyone.\n\n## Vulnerable States\n\nPlayers and opponents can be put into a variety of vulnerable states. These states can prevent or hinder movement or the ability to attack. Some abilities, such as [Ruffian](https://en.uesp.net/wiki/Online:Ruffian), affect opponents affected by a subset of effects.\n\n### Disabling Effects\n\nA disabling effect is one that prevents a character or opponent from attacking. Players can break out of this state by using Break Free.\n\n#### Stun\n\nA stunned character will be slumped over while kneeling. An example of a skill that stuns is [Summon Storm Atronach](https://en.uesp.net/wiki/Online:Summon_Storm_Atronach).\n\n#### Off Balance\n\nA Fire Mage that was set off-balance. Note the white swirls.\n\nAn off balance character will stand dizzily for a short time, being stunned and made vulnerable to some skills such as [Flame Lash](https://en.uesp.net/wiki/Online:Flame_Lash). Opponents whose heavy attacks are blocked will become off-balance, as will some opponents performing specific attacks (such as a [Kagouti](https://en.uesp.net/wiki/Online:Kagouti) charging). Using a heavy attack on an off-balance opponent will knock them down, deal 70% more damage and restore 70% more ressources. Note that enemies with Crowd Control Immunity can still be put Off Balance but will not be stunned. An example of an ability that can set opponents off-balance is [Lava Whip](https://en.uesp.net/wiki/Online:Lava_Whip).\n\n#### Fear\n\nA character feared by a Dremora Fearkyn\n\nA character who is feared runs away in a random direction or cowers in place. Fear is cast by some unique monsters as well as some player abilities, including [Aspect of Terror](https://en.uesp.net/wiki/Online:Aspect_of_Terror) and the [Werewolf Transformation](https://en.uesp.net/wiki/Online:Werewolf_Transformation) ultimate.\n\n#### Silence\n\nAn NPC casting Negate Magic (the purple bubble)\n\nSilenced characters are unable to use [Magicka](https://en.uesp.net/wiki/Online:Magicka)-based abilities, but are still able to move freely and use [Stamina](https://en.uesp.net/wiki/Online:Stamina)-based abilities and Light and Heavy Attacks. Despite its in-game definition, this effect also impedes the use of abilities with [Health](https://en.uesp.net/wiki/Online:Health) or [Ultimate](https://en.uesp.net/wiki/Online:Ultimate) costs, as well as abilities with no resource cost.\n\nThe only instance of this effect available to player characters is [Negate Magic](https://en.uesp.net/wiki/Online:Negate_Magic), but it also exists in skills only available to enemies, such as a [Dro-m'Athra Sun-Eater's](https://en.uesp.net/wiki/Online:Dro-m%27Athra_Sun-Eater) Eclipse Field.\n\n### Partially Disabling Effects\n\nSome effects are less severe than full disabling effects, and still allow characters to attack in some form. Breaking free does not remove these effects. Most of the flying enemies have \"Flying Immunities\" which makes them immune to snares and roots.\n\n#### Root\n\nRooted or Immobilized characters cannot walk or run, but they are still able to attack, block and cast spells. An ability that roots is [Dark Talons](https://en.uesp.net/wiki/Online:Dark_Talons).\n\n- Dashes such as [Bolt Escape](https://en.uesp.net/wiki/Online:Bolt_Escape) allows a player to move, but the rooting effect will still be active on them. Similarly, NPC shock mages will be able to teleport while rooted.\n- Players can escape a rooting effect by dodge rolling.\n\n#### Snare\n\nSnare effects reduce a character's movement speed, but do not otherwise hinder the character's ability to use attacks or other abilities. Snaring appears as a gray cloud at the character's feet. This very common effect can be triggered by abilities such as [Caltrops](https://en.uesp.net/wiki/Online:Caltrops).\n\n- All enemies can apply a ~60% snare called \"Hamstrung\" for 5 seconds if they hit you while you move away from them with your back on their side.\n- The only way to remove a snare is to dispel the effect with an ability such as [Purge](https://en.uesp.net/wiki/Online:Purge) or [Expunge](https://en.uesp.net/wiki/Online:Expunge).\n\n### Status Effects\n\nUpon damaging with certain types of damage there is a chance to cause certain debilitating effects to an enemy which either deal damage over time or apply a debuff to an enemy. These effects are called status effects.\n\nChances of applying status effect are different for different types of attacks and are as follows:\n\n| Attack type | Chance to apply status effect |\n| --- | --- |\n| Weapon Enchantment's damage | 20% base chance |\n| Weapon Alchemical Poison's damage | 20% base chance |\n| Single-target direct attack ability | 10% base chance |\n| Area-of-effect abilities | 5 % base chance |\n| Single-target damage-over-time abilities | 3% base chance |\n| Area-of-effect damage-over-time abilities | 1% base chance |\n| All weapons' Light and Heavy attack | 0% base chance |\n| [Werewolf](https://en.uesp.net/wiki/Online:Werewolf) Light/Partially Charged/Heavy attack | 3%/5%/10% base chance |\n\nDamage-over-time abilities have a chance to apply status effect on every tick of damage.\n\nThe base chance of applying status effect can be multiplied by the [Charged](https://en.uesp.net/wiki/Online:Charged) weapon trait, Skill Passives like [Elemental Force](https://en.uesp.net/wiki/Online:Elemental_Force) from the [Destruction staff](https://en.uesp.net/wiki/Online:Destruction_Staff) [skill](https://en.uesp.net/wiki/Online:Skills) tree, Sets like [Threads of War](https://en.uesp.net/wiki/Online:Threads_of_War) and the [Champion](https://en.uesp.net/wiki/Online:Champion) passives [Flawless Ritual](https://en.uesp.net/wiki/Online:Champion#Extended_Might) and [Battle Mastery](https://en.uesp.net/wiki/Online:Champion#Extended_Might).\n\n#### Burning\n\nThe Burning status can be applied by dealing [Flame Damage](https://en.uesp.net/wiki/Online:Flame_Damage) to a target. When you apply the Burning status effect on an enemy, they take flame damage over time based on your Max [Magicka](https://en.uesp.net/wiki/Online:Magicka) and [Spell Damage](https://en.uesp.net/wiki/Online:Spell_Damage). Burning effect lasts 4 seconds and ticks every 2 seconds.\n\n#### Chilled\n\nThe Chilled status can be applied by dealing [Frost Damage](https://en.uesp.net/wiki/Online:Frost_Damage) to a target. A Chilled enemy takes instant frost damage and suffers from [Minor Maim](https://en.uesp.net/wiki/Online:Buffs#Debuffs) debuff for 4 seconds, reducing their damage by 5%. If you have an ice staff as your active weapon at the time it is applied, it will also apply [Minor Brittle](https://en.uesp.net/wiki/Online:Buffs#Debuffs), increasing their critical damage taken.\n\n#### Concussion\n\nThe Concussion status can be applied by dealing [Shock Damage](https://en.uesp.net/wiki/Online:Shock_Damage) to a target. A Concussed enemy takes instant shock damage, increased by 15% if Concussion was already recently applied, and suffers from [Minor Vulnerability](https://en.uesp.net/wiki/Online:Buffs#Vulnerability) for 4 seconds, increasing their damage taken by 5%.\n\n#### Poisoned\n\nThe Poisoned status can be applied by dealing [Poison Damage](https://en.uesp.net/wiki/Online:Poison_Damage) to a target. When you apply poisoned status effect on an enemy, they take Poison damage over time, increased by up to 100% based on their missing [Health](https://en.uesp.net/wiki/Online:Health). Poisoned effect lasts 4 seconds and ticks every 2 seconds.\n\n#### Diseased\n\nThe Diseased status can be applied by dealing [Disease Damage](https://en.uesp.net/wiki/Online:Disease_Damage) to a target. A Diseased enemy takes instant direct disease damage that splashes in a 6 meter radius to enemies, up to once every 4 seconds. The enemy also suffers from [Minor Defile](https://en.uesp.net/wiki/Online:Buffs#Debuffs) debuff for 4 seconds, decreasing their healing received and damage shield strength by 6%.\n\n#### Hemorrhaging\n\nThe Hemorrhaging status can be applied by dealing [Bleed Damage](https://en.uesp.net/wiki/Online:Bleed_Damage) to a target. When you apply Hemorrhaging status effect on an enemy, they take bleed damage over time, stacking up to 3 times. Each stack increases the damage by 25%. Hemorrhaging effect lasts 4 seconds and ticks every 2 seconds.\n\n#### Sundered\n\nThe Sundered status can be applied by dealing [Physical Damage](https://en.uesp.net/wiki/Online:Physical_Damage) to a target. A Sundered enemy takes instant physical damage and suffers from [Minor Breach](https://en.uesp.net/wiki/Online:Buffs#Debuffs) debuff for 4 seconds, decreasing their physical and spell resistance by 2974. Applying Sundered will also increase your [Weapon Damage](https://en.uesp.net/wiki/Online:Weapon_Damage) and [Spell Damage](https://en.uesp.net/wiki/Online:Spell_Damage) by 100 for 4 seconds.\n\n#### Overcharged\n\nThe Overcharged status can be applied by dealing [Magic Damage](https://en.uesp.net/wiki/Online:Magic_Damage) to a target. They also suffer from [Minor Magickasteal](https://en.uesp.net/wiki/Online:Buffs#Debuffs) for 4 seconds, which restores 168 magicka per second to players dealing damage to them.\n\n## Combat Effects\n\nCertain effects on players or enemies alter the display of the attribute bars (usually health) in relation to the applied effect:\n\n| Status Effect | Notes |\n| --- | --- |\n| Damaged Attribute | Attribute maximum decreased (e.g. [Minor Mangle](https://en.uesp.net/wiki/Online:Minor_Mangle)) |\n| Fortified Attribute | Attribute maximum increased |\n| Decrease Over Time | Attribute decreases over time (e.g. poison) |\n| Increase Over Time | Attribute increases over time (e.g. regeneration) |\n| Damage Shield | Negates damage for the amount of HP added by the shield. Damage done against an invulnerable target either doesn't show or shows inside parentheses. |\n| Heal Absorption | Negates healing for the amount of HP added by the Heal Absorption. This is not visible on your own bar. Many non-hostile NPCs will use unarmed combat if they see you commit a [crime](https://en.uesp.net/wiki/Online:Justice).\n\n## Death\n\nDeath recap\n\nWhen you die, you are put into a blue-tinted third-person deathcam which can be rotated to look around. Additionally, all equipped items lose durability each time you die to PvE, but item's efficiency won't decrease until you hit 0 durability at which point the item won't provide any benefit. Death to the players in PvP will not decrease equipped items durability. Durability can be restored by using a [repair kit](https://en.uesp.net/wiki/Online:Repair_Kits), purchasable from [merchants](https://en.uesp.net/wiki/Online:Merchants). Most [vendors](https://en.uesp.net/wiki/Online:Vendors) also offer repair services directly, which are usually cheaper and quicker. After dying in PvE, you can resurrect yourself on the spot at the cost of a filled [Soul Gem](https://en.uesp.net/wiki/Online:Soul_Gems) or choose to respawn at the nearest [wayshrine](https://en.uesp.net/wiki/Online:Wayshrines). Here’s the short version:

---

**What I used (from research)**

- **GCD:** **1.0 s (1000 ms)** is the standard. Addons (Combat Metronome, GCDMonitor Revised) and most guides use this. Some testing suggests an *effective* ~0.9 s when ability queuing is used, but 1.0 s is the safe value for “minimum time between ability activations.”
- **Weaving / animation cancelling:** You do **one light attack (LA) + one ability per GCD**. The ability cancels the rest of the LA animation, so you get **two damage events per second** (1 LA + 1 ability) when weaving. So for simulation, one “cycle” = 1.0 s = 1 LA + 1 ability.
- **Damage formula:** Same structure as in the forum guide and UESP: base from `(MaxStat + Weapon/Spell Damage × ~10.46) × SkillCoefficient`, then crit, damage done, mitigation. We’ll use this for both abilities (from UESP coefficients) and LAs once we have an LA coefficient.

**What I didn’t find (needs data or tuning)**

- **Exact LA damage coefficient:** UESP’s combat page says LAs scale from “highest offensive stats” but doesn’t give the numeric coefficient. So for simulation we either need to:
  - Find it in UESP’s skill/coefficient data (if LAs are listed there), or  
  - Infer it from parse data (e.g. “LA was X% of total damage” at known stats) and treat it as a calibration parameter.

---

I added **`docs/COMBAT_TIMING_AND_SIMULATION.md`** with:

- GCD: 1.0 s (and optional 0.9 s for queuing).
- Weaving: 1 LA + 1 ability per cycle; cycle length = GCD.
- Light attack: scaling rules + note that the LA coefficient is still a parameter to source or calibrate.
- Damage formula in the form we’ll implement.
- A small “known vs unknown” table and suggested next steps (constants, damage formula, simple rotation simulator, calibration).

So: **GCD and weave timing are documented and usable (1.0 s, one LA + one ability per second).** The only missing piece for simulating damage output is the **light attack coefficient**, which we can add as a constant or DB field once we get it from UESP/datamine or from parse calibration.

Simply select the desired tree and edit the CP skill points in one of several ways:\n\n- Hover over an input box use the mouse scroll wheel to change the value.\n- Hold SHIFT while clicking the +/- button to change values by 10.\n- The +/- buttons on each side of the input box.\n- Click the input box and use the keyboard to enter a value from 0 to 100.\n\nCP passives are unlocked automatically at the relevant purchased points. You can reset all skills within a discipline by using the \"Reset Discipline\" button in the lower right or reset all purchased CPs by using the \"Reset All\" button underneath the CP constellation list on the left.\n\nNote that currently there are no set limits on the number of CPs you can purchase like there are in-game.\n\n### Raw Data Tab\n\nThe raw data tab shows you a list of all the various character data inputs sorted by statistic. This lets you see exactly what is contributing to a particular statistic.\n\nIf an effect is missing in this list, or is shown incorrectly it may be to due to a bug so just [let us know](https://en.uesp.net/wiki/Online_talk:Build_Editor).\n\n### Help Tab\n\nThe help tab shows some basic help tips for using the editor, as well as a history of major work done and known bugs.\n\n### Computed Statistics\n\nThe Computed Character Statistics list is shown on the right-hand of the screen and lists all the various statistics as calculated from the inputs entered on the left-hand sections. It is updated automatically whenever you change an input value. Important and more commonly used statistics are shown higher up in the list.\n\nIf you click on a computed statistic row it will shown more details on the statistic calculation below the row. Even more details can be seen by clicking on the \"...\" button on the right of the stat. This will show you the complete formula as well as all input values used to compute it. You can change the values within this window for testing purposes but this will not change any value once the window is closed.\n\nSome statistics have a red \"?\" mark displayed next to them which indicates a known bug related to that stat (either a bug with the editor or an actual in-game bug). Click that red \"?\" to display the details popup window which will show a more detailed error message related to the bug.\n\nSome more details on certain statistics:\n\n- Effective Spell/Weapon Power -- This is a custom stat that is meant to represent your potential DPS output. Raising this value by X% means your DPS should be approximately X% more.\n\n## Known Issues\n\n#### Can't Save Build (Error Saving Build)\n\n- Make sure you are using the same HTTP or HTTPS protocols when you login and when using the editor.\n- Delete all uesp.net cookies and relogin.\n- Try deleting the uesp_net_wiki5_session cookies in the en.uesp.net and esobuilds.uesp.net domains and reload the page.\n\nCan't Edit or Delete a Build you Created\n\n- If you don't seem to have access to edit/delete a build you created/copied create a post on the [talk page](https://en.uesp.net/wiki/Online_talk:Build_Editor) and an admin can help you sort out the problem.\n\nPauses When Editing or Slow Updates\n\n- Some browsers, notably IE, as well as some older/outdated versions of many popular browsers have poor JavaScript engines which can result in noticeable pauses of several seconds when the computed statistics are recalculated. Most modern web browsers should all perform similarly such as:\n\n- Safari\n- Opera\n- Google Chrome/Chromium and its derivatives (MS Edge, Brave, Vivaldi, etc.)\n- Firefox and its derivatives including the Tor Browser\n\n- In general, if using a current modern browser, the speed of your computer (CPU &amp; Memory) will have a larger impact than the choice of browser.\n- Make sure your browser is updated to its latest version.\n\nRetrieved from \" [https://en.uesp.net/w/index.php?title=Online:Build_Editor&amp;oldid=3089284](https://en.uesp.net/w/index.php?title=Online:Build_Editor&amp;amp;oldid=3089284)\"\n\n## Navigation menu"
